User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the Thainnes Cuba Ciuldin application.

email.description: The email address of the user.

createdAt.description: The date and time the user registered.

isAdmin.description: Flag to indicate if the user is an administrator.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile picture.

zipCode.description: The user's postal or zip code.

fcmTokens.description: An array of Firebase Cloud Messaging tokens for sending push notifications.

Client.title: Client
Client.description: Represents a client registered in the Thainnes Cuba Ciuldin application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the client entity.

firstName.description: The first name of the client.

lastName.description: The last name of the client.

email.description: The email address of the client.

phone.description: The phone number of the client.

registrationDate.description: The date and time the client registered.

Service.title: Service
Service.description: Represents a service offered by Thainnes Cuba Ciuldin.

id.description: Unique identifier for the service entity.

price.description: The base price of the service. If isPriceFrom is true, this is the starting price.

durationMinutes.description: The duration of the service in minutes.

imageId.description: ID of the service image from the galleryImages collection.

isPriceFrom.description: Indicates if the price is a starting price ('a partir de').

priceShortHair.description: Price for short hair, if applicable.

priceMediumHair.description: Price for medium hair, if applicable.

priceLongHair.description: Price for long hair, if applicable.

Promotion.title: Promotion
Promotion.description: Represents a promotion offered by Thainnes Cuba Ciuldin.

id.description: Unique identifier for the promotion entity.

discountPercentage.description: The discount percentage offered by the promotion.

startDate.description: The start date of the promotion.

endDate.description: The end date of the promotion.

serviceIds.description: References to Services. (Relationship: Promotion N:N Service)

imageId.description: ID of the promotion image from the galleryImages collection.

Appointment.title: Appointment
Appointment.description: Represents an appointment Marcado by a client.

id.description: Unique identifier for the appointment entity.

startTime.description: The start time of the appointment.

endTime.description: The end time of the appointment.

status.description: The status of the appointment (e.g., Marcado, finalizado, cancelado).

hairLength.description: Selected hair length for variable price services.

hairPhotoUrl.description: URL of the uploaded hair reference photo.

finalPrice.description: The final price of the appointment, considering variations.

viewedByAdmin.description: Flag to indicate if an admin has viewed the appointment.

ThemeSettings.title: ThemeSettings
ThemeSettings.description: Stores the dynamic theme settings for the application.

primary.description: The primary color in HSL format (e.g., '271 76% 34%').

secondary.description: The secondary color in HSL format (e.g., '271 50% 80%').

accent.description: The accent color in HSL format (e.g., '330 100% 71%').

background.description: The background color in HSL format (e.g., '240 67% 94%').

foreground.description: The foreground color (main text) in HSL format.

card.description: The card background color in HSL format.

cardForeground.description: The card foreground color (text) in HSL format.

SocialMediaLinks.title: SocialMediaLinks
SocialMediaLinks.description: Stores the URLs for the business's social media profiles.

NotificationSettings.title: NotificationSettings
NotificationSettings.description: Stores the contact details for sending admin notifications.

notificationEmail.description: The email address for sending new appointment notifications.

notificationWhatsapp.description: The WhatsApp number (including country code) for sending new appointment notifications.

BusinessHours.title: BusinessHours
BusinessHours.description: Stores the business's opening hours and days of operation.

startTime.description: The opening time in HH:mm format (e.g., '09:00').

endTime.description: The closing time in HH:mm format (e.g., '18:00').

workingDays.description: An array of numbers representing the days of the week the business is open (0=Sunday, 1=Monday, ..., 6=Saturday).

GalleryImage.title: GalleryImage
GalleryImage.description: Represents an image in the gallery, stored in Firebase Storage.

id.description: Unique identifier for the image document.

imageUrl.description: The public URL of the image in Firebase Storage.

description.description: A brief description of the image.

fileName.description: The name of the file in Firebase Storage.

createdAt.description: The date and time the image was uploaded.

HeroBanner.title: HeroBanner
HeroBanner.description: Stores the content for the home page hero banner.

imageId.description: ID of the banner image from the galleryImages collection.

buttonText.description: The text for the call-to-action button.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support Thainnes Cuba Ciuldin's core features with a focus on security, scalability, and ease of debugging. It follows the principles of Authorization Independence, Structural Segregation, and Access Modeling.  

*   **Users (Private Data with Admin Override):** User data is stored in a top-level `/users/{userId}` collection. This allows users to manage their own profile information while enabling administrators to have oversight.
*   **Services (Public Data):** Services are stored in a single collection `/services/{serviceId}`. This allows for easy listing and retrieval of all available services.
*   **Promotions (Public Data with Service References):** Promotions are stored in a single collection `/promotions/{promotionId}`.  Each promotion document contains an array `serviceIds` referencing the services to which the promotion applies.  This allows for easy listing and retrieval of all promotions.
*   **Appointments (Centralized with Ownership):** Appointments are stored in a single, top-level `/appointments/{appointmentId}` collection. This simplifies queries for administrators who need to view all appointments. Each appointment document contains a `clientId` field to link it to the user who created it, ensuring data ownership can still be enforced in security rules. This is more efficient for admin-level queries than nesting appointments under each user.
*   **Theme (Public Data, Admin Writable):** Theme settings are stored in a single document `/theme/global` for easy public access, allowing the app to load visual styles dynamically for all users, while write access is restricted to administrators.
*   **Social Media (Public Data, Admin Writable):** Social media links are stored in a single document `/socialMedia/links` for easy public access, allowing the app to display them in the footer dynamically, while write access is restricted to administrators.
* **Config (Private, Admin-only & Publicly Readable):** A `/config` collection stores general application settings. The document `/config/notifications` holds the contact details for sending admin alerts and is only readable/writable by admins. The new document `/config/businessHours` will store the business operating hours and will be publicly readable but only admin writable.
* **Gallery Images (Public Data, Admin Writable):** A new top-level collection `/galleryImages/{imageId}` is added to store metadata about uploaded images, such as their Firebase Storage URL and a description. This allows the images to be publicly read by the application for use in services and promotions, while restricting write access to administrators.
* **Content (Public Data, Admin Writable):** A new `/content` collection is added to store general, dynamic content for the site. The document `/content/heroBanner` holds the data for the home page's main banner, allowing it to be easily edited by an admin.

**Authorization Independence:**

*   Authorization Independence is achieved by avoiding `get()` calls in the security rules where possible. Client data is secured via path-based rules under `/users/{userId}`. Admin access is handled by checking a flag on the user's own document.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**

*   The structure enables secure `list` operations by segregating data based on access requirements. Public data (services, promotions, theme, socialMedia, galleryImages, content) resides in dedicated collections. The centralized `/appointments` collection allows admins to `list` all documents, while individual user queries are filtered by `where('clientId', '==', uid)` on the client-side, which is then enforced by security rules.
